Sección
General Information
SCHEDULE

Wednesday - March 26th (15:15 -17:15 h)

• Brief introduction for the students about us and our university
• LESSON

Thursday - March 27th (13:15-15:15 h) 

• WORKSHOP (ArcGIS, RStudio and InkScape)

Friday - March 28th (11:15-13:15) and (14:15-16:15)

• WORKSHOP (Guided students exercise)
Text and Tasks
DESCRIPTION OF THE LESSON

CONTAINS:

  • Brief introduction to delineation of stream lines in cartography.
  • Automatic extraction of stream networks from DEMs.
  • Common flow extraction algorithms:
    •  D8
    •  D∞
    •  KRA

   

                             Main common low extraction algorithms used in GIS (from left to right: D8, D∞ and KRA).
 

  • Statistical analysis 
    • Introduction to statistical analysis for circular data
    • Circular statistics applied to delineation of stream lines in cartography
    • Statistical graphics

                 

Examples of circular data distributions (azimuths) plotted in (from left to right) raw plot, circular histogram and circular-linear plot.
Text and Tasks
DESCRIPTION OF THE WORKSHOP

• Objectives
  • Data
  • Detection of sensitive areas
    • Network comparison
    • Filtering errors

 

Taking as a reference each of the points in the automatically derived (DEM) stream network, the coordinates of the respective nearest points in the cartographic stream line can be determined by generating a table in ArcGIS.

  • Detection of sensitive areas
    • Statistical analysis of circular data
      • Random errors
      • Large errors
  • Labelling of sensitive areas
  • Metadata

  

Points in the automatic stream line are measured to the same nearest point in the cartographic stream line, producing an aligned series of points in the graphical statistical plot.

Before starting with the workshop, it would be highly recommended that students watch these videos to better understand the starting point and what we are going to do in the workshop.

Text and Tasks
Quiz (To be completed after the contents of the lesson have been explained)
Question 1
Provide instruction on how the True/False Question should be completed.
University of Auckland
Enter any feedback you wish to provide to the learner. This field may be left blank. if this field is left blank default feedback will be provided.
A hint may be provided to assist the learner in answering the question.

True/false questions present a statement where the learner must decide if the statement is true. This type of question works well for factual information and information that lends itself to either/or responses.
Type the question stem. The question should be clear and unambiguous. Avoid negative premises as these can tend to be ambiguous.
Escriba la pregunta. La pregunta debe ser clara y no ambigua. Evite las premisas negativas ya que esta tienden a ser ambiguas.
If you calculate a stream line with the same DEM, all flow direction calculation algorithms return the same results.

Introduzca la retroalimentación que quiere que vean los estudiantes después de haber intentado completar la actividad. Este campo se puede dejar vacío. Si este campo está vacío se ofrecerá la retroalimentación por defecto.
Se puede proporcionar una pista para ayudar al estudiante a responder la pregunta.

D8 is a one-dimensional flow where directions are restricted to multiple angles of 45°.

Question 3
University of Auckland

Although more often used in formal testing situations MCQs can be used as a testing tool to stimulate thought and discussion on topics students may feel a little reticent in responding to. When designing a MCQ test consider the following:
  • What learning outcomes are the questions testing
  • What intellectual skills are being tested
  • What are the language skills of the audience
  • Gender and cultural issues
  • Avoid grammar language and question structures that might provide clues

When building an MCQ consider the following:
  • Use phrases that learners are familiar with and have encountered in their study
  • Keep responses concise
  • There should be some consistency between the stem and the responses
  • Provide enough options to challenge learners to think about their response
  • Try to make sure that correct responses are not more detailed than the distractors
  • Distractors should be incorrect but plausible
Introduzca la pregunta. La pregunta debe ser clara y no ambigua. Evite las premisas negativas ya que estas tienden a confundir a los estudiantes.

The vector of the positional error is generated from a pair of Cartesian coordinates: the initial node in the measured position (Xm, Ym) and the end node in the true position (Xt, Yt).
